result.execSummary:
The defendant Bird Xang Kong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of the two.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent approval.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.  

SAFE program.  Provide DNA sample. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: FTE/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week if defendant is able to work.

AODA and follow through.  

SAFE assessment and follow through.  

Assessment, treatment, counseling deemed appropriate by the Department.  

Court costs as previously assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Sentencing Hearing on Revocation 
August 10th, 2017
Judge Jacobson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: to Modify Sentence Credit

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 3:04 pm 
INCLUDES 14CF725, 15CF262, AND 16CM958. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Pauline Toulouse. 
VRCW. 
State notes parties have agreement re: 16CM958 and will be arguing re: 15CF262 and 14CF725. 
Argument re: 15CF262 and 14CF725. 
Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 16CM958: Ct. 1>>90 days MCJ with 90 days credit.  
In 14CF725: Ct. 1>>6.5 years mprisonment - 2.5 years IC & 4 years ES - with 258 days sentence credit. 
In 15CF262: Ct. 2>>5.5 years imprisonment - 2.5 years IC & 3 years ES - with 353 days sentence credit. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS OF ES in 14CF725 & 15CF262: AODA and follow through; SAFE assessment and follow through; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week if deft is able to work; CC. 

COURT ORDERS sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other. 
COURT finds the deft eligible fro CIP and SAP. 
COURT remands deft into custody for transport to WSPS. 
Adj: 3:33 pm
from defendant dated 07/01/2017 requesting a different hearing date; cc ADA Kerri Puig and Attorney Pauline Toulouse; stj
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 10, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 28, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 20, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Request/Agreement for Modification to Conditions of Probation - approved 5/16/16
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Probable Cause Found
of Preliminary Examination

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:51 am 
INCLUDES 14CF725, 14CF801, 14CM1105, AND 15CF262. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person with Atty Kat Jackan.  

WAIVER OF PRELIMINARY HEARINGS IN 14CF725 AND 15CF262. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Informations filed. 

PLEA HEARING IN ALL FILES. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
State moves to: 
In 14CF725: Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>D&RI. 
In 14CF801: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 14CM1105: Ct. 2 (Criminal Damage to Property/DA)>>D&RI. 
                       : Ct. 3 (DC/DA)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF262: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 14CF725: Ct. 1 (Possession with Intent - Amphetamine)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 14CM1105: Ct. 1 (Battery/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CF262: Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
State makes statement. Atty Jackan makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: In 14CM1105: Ct. 1 >>5 months MCJ with 2 days jail credit; provide DNA sample - def to go to jail to make arrangements; and payment of court costs including 1 DA surcharge. 
                           : In 14CF725: Ct. 1 and in 15CF262: Ct. 2 >>SWH for 3 years probation to begin immediately - CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; SAFE program; AODA; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent approval; good faith effort to maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2; payment of court costs; provide DNA sample. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 5 days jail credit in 14CF725 if revoked and no days credit in 15CF262. 

Adj: 10:15 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 3, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Atty Jackan states defendant not prepared to enter plea today - need additional discovery.

Bond continues.
